website_summaries.verdict: A knife both righties AND southpaws can use. It's good for making straight cuts in coroplast and other corrugated media, but for angles and curves, consider another cutter.
pros: Rust-resistant stainless steel snap-off blade knife
Designed for both right and left-handed use – lefties should just install the blades upside down for reverse use
Lightweight, slim and comfortable to use
cons: The blades that come with this tool could be better
consider replacing them with something higher quality when you are done with the initial set

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without my NT!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional vehicle wrap installer for 16 years. I can not live without my NT! I have owned over a dozen of these knifes, because people steel them. These knives last forever. The longest I was able to hold onto one was 8 years! I like to take pliers and gently squeeze the end where the blade come out, this keeps the blade from slightly moving back and forth when cutting pinstripes and such. I keep a hand full of stainless blades for when I am cutting on windows and I use the black high carbon blades for table work and general cutting. High carbon blades cut windows. Stainless won't.
customer_reviews.author: EricTheDesigner

customer_reviews.title: Handiest Item Ever and Better Built than OLFA
customer_reviews.text: I carried the OLFA equivalent of this around for years and although they're both great, the metal blade adjustment on this unit feels more sturdy than the OLFA and has a better look IMO. Only downside versus the OLFA is that the tip of the OLFA is more pointed, which can be useful as a screwdriver or poking device. Modifying the tip of the NT is easy enough with a Dremel or similar tool though.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Keebler

customer_reviews.title: It works but it bends easily
customer_reviews.text: Really like this blade. The autolock works well. (a little different from what I'm use to at the wrapshop I work at) Everything is good but if you place this blade in any pant pocket it WILL bend. Usually when I'm using a squeegee while squatting or in an awkward position, half the time the knife is in my pocket so yeah they're bent. First time having this issue as well. Other than that these are my backups and work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Lebron

customer_reviews.title: Aside from the blade Whats not to like
customer_reviews.text: Item is sharp same or equal to any exacto that i have ever used. The main issue with exactos is tip keeps breaking off. This is over all much better, the blade is much sturdier and its more comfortable to hold and store. I would definately replace the blade when used with a more suitable blade problably one thats made of stainless steel just like the handle....i would definately buy this item again..
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: The best knife for professionals
customer_reviews.text: The best knife for professionals. High quality material and build. not the best blades though. they are not stainless and will rust. i recommend olfa stainless blades. the blade that comes with the NT cutter WILL rust.
customer_reviews.author: S Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good but doesn't Lock
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why they call it an "Auto-Lock", because it doesn't lock in any way shape or form. Construction seems sound enough, and it is nice in slim so if fits in my pocket without taking up the whole thing. I'll probably buy it again if I need another one, but I'll look around first for one that actually locks.
customer_reviews.author: DodgeBall

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if the stainless steel blade is any better They sell one for a few $ cheaper that does not say SS Blade) but I got that to be sure. Very nice quality, very sharp. Easy to use. Might buy a spare
customer_reviews.author: Ron Feigen

customer_reviews.title: The Go-To Tool I Use For Cutting Window Tint
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for tinting windows, I'll make this short and sweet! -It does what it is intended for: Cutting stuff with ease -What do I use it for: Cutting window tint. -Why is it helpful for this: I avoid cutting into or scratching the surface of the glass. -Which products do I use in conjunction with this: -Would I recommend to a friend: Yes if he wants to tint windows. Thanks For Reading!
customer_reviews.author: Enzo

customer_reviews.title: It's a lot easier to carry around than a heavy, standard box cutter.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised that the PRO isn't a bit more... of a wider, nicer looking cutter. I've used the cheaper, plastic NT Cutter A-300 by the same manufacturer (I think) for over 20 years and it's easier handling and width is better. Still gets 5-stars as it works and looks as advertised and like all products that use the same snap off blades, it's a lot easier to carry around than a heavy, standard box cutter.
customer_reviews.author: ShyWriter™

customer_reviews.title: Feels good
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight to this, nice and balanced, not exceedingly heavy but you can tell you're holding it. Sturdy, durable. I bought the set.
customer_reviews.author: Graidian

customer_reviews.title: Mini Retractable Katana
customer_reviews.text: Elegant, sturdy and sharp as hell. This is a great compact blade for delicate projects. Bless the Japanese. They did it again.
customer_reviews.author: 𓀕 𓁆 𓀟 𓁆 𓀕 𓁆 𓀟 𓁆 𓀕 🕳

customer_reviews.title: Good tool. It works and I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using quality tools. After fighting with a junk plastic cutter, I decided I wanted one that works. Mine came with 2 blades. Blades are sharp and snap easily for a new edge. Blade adjustment glides smoothly and locks into place without additional effort. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fred E. Elum

customer_reviews.title: I love this knife
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife! The blades are very sharp and strong. The small size allows for easy use for navigating tight corners and profiles. The integrated blade breaker makes it simple to break off a dull section of blade. Great for upholstery work.

customer_reviews.title: awsome blade.
customer_reviews.text: Introduced to my by a veteran sign guy. Best blade I’ve used. In my opinion, the sleekness allows for one hand multi tasking, the clip blade break saves space and the construction is solid.

customer_reviews.title: A really nice Stainless steel low profile form factor arts and crafts knife.
customer_reviews.text: It's a really nice Stainless steel low profile form factor arts and crafts knife. Coupled with the NT 30 degree blades it is a great replacement for an exacto knife. I am very happy with it. Build quality is good and it seems to be well made.

customer_reviews.title: Solid feel and robust "clicks"
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to use with robust "clicks" as you slide the blade in and out. Blade stays firm when set as it should. Blades are like any other, so I got this cutter first and foremost to have the better mechnics and feel that you get with a solid metal type cutter.

customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice utility knife. I used it to replace the gasket in a speaker that had rotted. It was great for scraping off the old glue. It worked well and is a great size for small projects.

customer_reviews.title: Not substantial. I needed more... "body" from this
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't tell from the product images that this was so thin, and I'm afraid I have to describe it as "nearly flimsy" I'd not purchase this again, with other options out there. I THOUGHT this was going to be a much more ergonomic, semi-oval barrel/body with storage for a few extra blades, but this is single, thin, and unfortunatley, quite flat. There's not a great place to snap blades off, which is another disappointment. I'd much rather have a $2 plastic one that I can lose or throw away instead of this. I paid for what I thought it was, and it's not that, sadly. (helpful?)

product_meta.title: NT Cutter PRO Auto-Lock Stainless Steel Utility Knife (A-1P)
product_meta.description: NT's Pro-line stainless steel knife is often referred to as the "Red Dot" knife in the professional window tinting business. This slim knife is ideal for free hand precision trimming jobs. For precision tinting, this window tint cutter is the premier choice amongst the professionals in the graphics industry. This rust resistant stainless steel holder now comes with NT's high-grade stainless steel blade which makes this the perfect tool for cutting damp window film, wallpaper, etc. Convenient snap off utility knife has an extra high quality stainless steel sliding track which allows the blade to glide in and out smoothly. Ratchet Auto-Lock slider will hold the blade secure for maximum cutting efficiency. End cap also functions as a blade snapper. Designed for right and left handed use with a simple reversal of blade. The blade used in this professional snap off knife is made of extra high quality stainless steel and produced through multiple stages of precise process to obtain the ultimate sharpness and optimum edge-retention. Made in Japan.
feature_bullets: Standard duty rust resistant stainless steel snap off blade knife with stainless steel blade
With built-in blade snapper and pocket clip / Designed for right and left handed use
Replacement blade: BA-50SS, BA-160, BA-50P (BA-51P, BA-53P and BA-40000-ON are also applicable)
Cutting Material: Window film, paper, wallpaper, card stock, vinyl, etc.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.9 out of 5 stars254 ratings4.9 out of 5 stars
